intro: Cyclosorus leucadenius, commonly known as the white-flowered water clover, is a member of the Hydrocharitaceae family. It is a submerged aquatic plant characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves that are often arranged in whorls. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically borne on long, slender stalks. It thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
